Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: First Ill look at the raw log The user switches between Microsoft Word Chrome email Acrobat and Excel Each time they focus on a different window or document it might indicate a new case or a continuation of the same case For example starting with Word on Quarterly_Report then switching to Document1 That could be two separate documents theyre working on so two cases Then they go to email which seems like a separate task handling an email Then PDF review then Excel budget update then back to Document1 then Quarterly_Report again

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: So potential cases Case 1 Quarterly_Reportdocx start at 085950 but no action until later Actually at 085950 FOCUS then immediately at 090000 FOCUS on Document1 So no activity on Quarterly_Report at the start But later at 090715 they focus on it again and type So the first FOCUS might be just opening it but without further actions should it be a case In process mining a case usually has at least one activity So maybe the case starts when they first do something meaningful

Name: Abductive Reasoning - IND
Text: For Quarterly_Report events from the first FOCUS to the CLOSE but theres a gap where they worked on other things So the case might have a start at 085950 but no activity until 090715 That might be okay if we consider the case as the lifecycle of that document from open to close But in between they were working on other documents so the case is not continuous Thats fine cases can have gaps But is it one case or two separate sessions on the same document The user closed it at the end and there was a focus at start and then later Probably one case for Quarterly_Report from first open to close with a period of inactivity in between

Name: Backtracking - NE
Text: Hmm Looking at the sequence 085950 FOCUS Quarterly_Report 090000 FOCUS Document1 So they opened Quarterly_Report but then immediately switched to Document1 without typing or saving Possibly they just opened it but didnt work on it yet Then later they come back to it So the case for Quarterly_Report should start when they first interact meaningfully which might be at 090715 when they type But the initial FOCUS is part of the case I think for process mining we include all events related to a case including opening and closing So for Quarterly_Report the first FOCUS as the start event But then theres a gap with other cases

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So cases based on window titlesdocument names Quarterly_Reportdocx Document1docx Email handling Report_Draftpdf Budget_2024xlsx But check if Quarterly_Report and Document1 are separate Yes different files Now activities need to translate raw actions to higherlevel names Raw actions FOCUS TYPING SAVE SWITCH CLICK SCROLL HIGHLIGHT CLOSE But SWITCH is between apps not really an activity within a case In process mining we usually only include events that are part of the case SWITCH might indicate moving to another case so we might not include switch events in the event log

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Approach treat each windowdocument as a separate case All events that occur while that window is focused belong to that case But the log has events with specific window titles So we can assign each event to a case based on the Window attribute SWITCH events have FromWindow and ToWindow Which case does a SWITCH event belong to It might be the transition between cases so it could belong to the fromcase as the last event or the toc ase as the first or neither Since its a system event indicating switch it might not be part of any cases process So we can exclude SWITCH events from the event log Then cases start with the first substantive action in a window

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: For FOCUS events what activity name For documents FOCUS likely means the user brought the window to the foreground it could be Open Document if its the first time or Switch to Document if already open But we dont know if the document was already open From context for Quarterly_Report the first FOCUS at 085950 might be opening it since its the first mention Then at 090715 they focus it again after working on Document1 so it was still open So we could call the first Open Document and the second Activate Document or Switch to Document But to standardize maybe all FOCUS on a document are Work on Document

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Now for the email case without SWITCH the first event is CLICK at 090200 Thats fine For Acrobat first event is SCROLL at 090430 but there is a SWITCH to Acrobat at 090400 If we exclude SWITCH then the first event for Acrobat case is SCROLL Should we have a FOCUS event In the log there is no FOCUS for Acrobat the SWITCH includes ToApp and ToWindow but not a FOCUS action So the first event in Acrobat is SCROLL So for the case we start with SCROLL But is SCROLL a meaningful activity Yes Review Document or Scroll PDF So okay

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Raw actions FOCUS TYPING SAVE CLICK SCROLL HIGHLIGHT CLOSE We need higherlevel names that represent process steps For document editing Word Excel FOCUS Open Document if first TYPING Edit Document SAVE Save Document CLOSE Close Document For Google Chrome email CLICK depending on Action Open Email Reply to Email Send Email SCROLL Read Email TYPING Compose Email For Adobe Acrobat SCROLL Review PDF HIGHLIGHT Highlight Text

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: For FOCUS If its the first event for the case by time then activity Open Document Else activity Activate Document For TYPING activity Edit Content For SAVE Save Document For CLOSE Close Document For CLICK with Action Open Email Reply to Email Send Email For SCROLL Review For HIGHLIGHT Annotate But for email SCROLL is Review which is fine
